item.title: 加息步伐可能受阻，瑞穗高管呼吁加快日本央行债券缩减速度
item.description: 瑞穗金融集团（Mizuho Financial Group）市场主管告诉路透社，日本央行应加快缩减政府债券购买规模的步伐，因为暂停加息的可能性将为央行调整缩减计划提供更大的回旋余地。【原文：The Bank of Japan should pick up the pace of tapering government bond purchases as the possibility of a pause in interest rate hikes will give the central bank more wiggle room to adjust the tapering plan, Mizuho Financial Group's markets chief told Reuters.】

item.title: 韩国发现 "韩国制造 "违规意在规避美国关税
item.description: 韩国海关机构周一表示，韩国发现有越来越多的人企图将外国产品伪装成韩国出口产品，主要是来自中国的产品，以规避美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的全面关税。【原文：South Korea has found rising attempts to disguise foreign products as Korean exports, mostly from China, to avoid U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs, its customs agency said on Monday.】

item.title: 中国反对美国和其他国家之间任何以牺牲中国利益为代价的交易
item.description: 中国商务部周一表示，中国尊重各方通过平等协商解决与美国的经贸分歧，但坚决反对任何一方以牺牲中国利益为代价达成交易。【原文：China respects all parties resolving economic and trade differences with the United States through consultation on an equal footing, but it will firmly oppose any party striking a deal at China's expense, its Commerce Ministry said on Monday.】

item.title: 美元因担心特朗普领导下的美联储独立性而走软
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普总统计划动摇美联储，这将使央行的独立性受到质疑，投资者对美国经济的信心再次受到打击，美元周一暴跌。【原文：The dollar tumbled on Monday as investor confidence in the U.S. economy took another hit over President Donald Trump's plans to shake up the Federal Reserve, which would throw into question the independence of the central bank.】

item.title: 美国加征关税，韩国4月1-20日出口下降
item.description: 周一的海关数据显示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）实施全面关税政策的背景下，韩国4月份前20天的出口额同比下降了5.2%，这主要是受输美货物的拖累。【原文：South Korea's exports for the first 20 days of April fell 5.2% from a year earlier, dragged down by U.S.-bound shipments, customs data showed on Monday, amid President Donald Trump's sweeping tariff policies.】

item.title: 美伊谈判取得进展，油价下跌 1
item.description: 周一亚洲开盘时，油价下跌超过 1%，因为美国和伊朗之间的核谈判取得了进展，缓解了供应担忧。【原文：Oil prices fell more than 1% at Monday's open in Asia after nuclear talks between the United States and Iran progressed, easing supply concerns.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比希望美国不要走向货币独立性受质疑的境地
item.description: 奥斯汀-古尔斯比告诉哥伦比亚广播公司的 "Fact the Nation "节目，有能力在不受政治干扰的情况下执行货币政策的中央银行，其经济结果会更好。【原文：Austan Goolsbee told CBS' "Fact the Nation" that central banks that have the ability to conduct monetary policy with no political tampering have better outcomes for their economies.】

item.title: 首尔称韩美将于本周举行贸易谈判
item.description: 首尔贸易部周日表示，在美国的建议下，韩国和美国将于本周在华盛顿举行贸易磋商。【原文：South Korea and the United States will hold trade consultations this week in Washington at the suggestion of the United States, Seoul's trade ministry said on Sunday.】

item.title: DHL 将暂停向美国消费者运送超过 800 美元的全球快件
item.description: 德国邮政旗下的DHL快递公司表示，由于美国海关监管的变化延长了清关时间，该公司将从4月21日起暂停向美国个人发送价值超过800美元的全球企业对消费者快件。【原文：DHL Express, a division of Germany's Deutsche Post , said it would suspend global business-to-consumer shipments worth over $800 to individuals in the United States from April 21, as U.S. customs regulatory changes have lengthened clearance.】

item.title: 中国的美国特使敦促结束贸易战，但警告北京已做好战斗准备
item.description: 中国驻美国大使谢锋敦促华盛顿与中国政府求同存异、和平共处，同时警告说，中国随时准备在不断升级的贸易战中采取报复行动。【原文：China's ambassador to the United States, Xie Feng, has urged Washington to seek common ground with Beijing and pursue peaceful coexistence while warning that China stood ready to retaliate in the escalating trade war.】

item.title: 波音飞机从中国返回美国，成为特朗普关税战的牺牲品
item.description: 一架供中国航空公司使用的波音飞机周日降落在该飞机制造商的美国生产中心，成为唐纳德-特朗普总统在其全球贸易攻势中发起的针锋相对的双边关税的受害者。【原文：A Boeing jet intended for use by a Chinese airline landed back at the planemaker's U.S. production hub on Sunday, a victim of the tit-for-tat bilateral tariffs launched by President Donald Trump in his global trade offensive.】

item.title: 石破首相：日本寻求与美国进行 "公平 "的货币谈判
item.description: 特朗普指责东京故意削弱日元，使其出口商获得不公平的优势。【原文：Trump accused Tokyo of intentionally weakening the yen to give its exporters an unfair advantage.】

item.title: 别克终于有了美国人想买的汽车--关税随之而来
item.description: 别克最受欢迎的三款车型都是在美国以外生产的，这意味着所有三款车型现在都要缴纳高额关税，这可能会使美国经销商的贴纸价格增加数千美元。【原文：Buick’s three most popular models are made outside the U.S. That means all three are now subject to stiff tariffs that could add thousands to sticker prices on dealer lots in the U.S.】

item.title: 马斯克表示将在与莫迪会谈后访问印度
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周六表示，他计划在今年晚些时候访问印度，此前一天，印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）表示，他曾与这位亿万富翁企业家讨论过技术问题。【原文：Elon Musk said on Saturday he was planning to visit India later in the year, a day after Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said he had discussed technology with the billionaire entrepreneur.】

item.title: 关税不确定性下台湾沽空限制再度延长
item.description: 台湾最高金融监管机构周六表示，将延长对股票卖空的临时限制措施，以帮助确保股市稳定，但没有给出取消限制的最终日期。【原文：Taiwan's top financial regulator said on Saturday it would extend temporary curbs on the short-selling of shares to help ensure stock market stability, and did not give an end date for when the restrictions might be lifted.】

item.title: 中国造船企业抨击特朗普 "短视 "的美国港口收费政策
item.description: 中国的造船企业周六抨击美国总统唐纳德-特朗普政府宣布对与中国有联系的船舶征收港口费是 "短视的"，这一措施针对的是中国的造船业。【原文：China's shipbuilders on Saturday blasted as "short-sighted" U.S. port fees announced by President Donald Trump's administration on China-linked ships, a measure aimed at the nation's shipbuilding industry.】

item.title: 中国商飞公司在越南开始商业运营
item.description: 中国商用飞机有限责任公司（COMAC）称，两架中国制造的C909飞机已于周六开始在越南执行航线飞行任务。【原文：Two Chinese-made COMAC aircraft, branded as C909, started flying routes in Vietnam on Saturday, Commercial Aircraft Corporation of China (COMAC), the Chinese planemaker said.】

item.title: 读卖新闻》报道：日本考虑在美国关税谈判中对大豆和大米做出让步
item.description: 据日本《读卖新闻》周六报道，日本正在考虑增加大豆和大米的进口量，作为与美国就唐纳德-特朗普总统的全面关税进行贸易谈判时的让步。【原文：Japan is considering increasing its soybean and rice imports as a concession in trade negotiations with the U.S. over President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs, Japan's Yomiuri daily reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 中国在半程马拉松比赛中让仿人机器人与人类对抗
item.description: 在周六举行的北京亦庄半程马拉松赛上，21 台仿人机器人与数千名选手一起参加了比赛，这是这些机器首次在 21 公里（13 英里）的赛道上与人类并肩作战。【原文：Twenty-one humanoid robots joined thousands of runners at the Yizhuang half-marathon in Beijing on Saturday, the first time these machines have raced alongside humans over a 21-km (13-mile) course.】

item.title: 特朗普将为全美 10 个采矿项目提供快速审批通道
item.description: 白宫周五表示，作为唐纳德-特朗普总统推动扩大关键矿产生产的一部分，白宫将快速审批全美10个采矿项目。【原文：The White House on Friday said it will fast-track permitting for 10 mining projects across the United States as part of President Donald Trump's push to expand critical minerals production.】

item.title: 赫兹首席执行官表示，比尔-阿克曼的支持令他深感荣幸
item.description: 在亿万富翁投资人比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）发表评论后，赫兹公司首席执行官表示，他感到非常惭愧，比尔-阿克曼的投资管理公司潘兴广场（Pershing Square）最近累计持有这家汽车租赁公司 19.8% 的股份。【原文：The CEO of Hertz said he feels humbled following comments by billionaire investor Bill Ackman, whose investment management company Pershing Square recently accumulated a 19.8% stake in the car rental firm.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，特斯拉将推迟在美国推出经济型电动汽车--成本更低的 Model Y
item.description: 三位知情人士告诉路透社记者，特斯拉备受期待的平价汽车计划包括其最畅销的电动 SUV Model Y 的精简版，该车将在美国生产，但投产时间已被推迟。【原文：Tesla's much-awaited plans for an affordable car include a stripped-down version of its best-selling electric SUV, the Model Y, that will be made in the United States, but the production launch has been delayed, three sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 聚焦：在特朗普的贸易战中，银行家们发挥创意签署并购交易
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策导致全球市场横盘之后，硅谷私募股权公司银湖合伙公司（Silver Lake Partners）在其与芯片制造商英特尔（Intel）历时数月谈判达成的交易中增加了一些新条款。【原文：After U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs sent global markets sideways, Silicon Valley private equity firm Silver Lake Partners added some new terms to a deal it had spent months negotiating with chipmaker Intel.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：因关税问题，福特停止向中国出口汽车
item.description: 华尔街日报》周五援引知情人士的话报道称，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收关税后，福特汽车公司已停止向中国运输其 SUV、皮卡和跑车。【原文：Ford Motor has halted shipments of its SUVs, pick-up trucks and sport cars to China in the wake of President Donald Trump's tariffs, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 消息人士称，KKR 是争夺阿布扎比地区制冷业务的资产管理公司之一
item.description: 三位消息人士称，KKR 和 I Squared Capital 是竞购阿布扎比倍增集团（Multiply Group）所拥有的区域冷却业务的全球资产管理公司之一，倍增集团是阿联酋最有权势的酋长之一所监管的 1.5 万亿美元帝国的一部分。【原文：KKR and I Squared Capital are among global asset managers bidding for a district cooling business owned by Abu Dhabi's Multiply Group, part of a $1.5 trillion empire overseen by one of the UAE's most powerful Sheikhs, three sources said.】

item.title: 受特朗普关税影响，沃尔沃将在美国裁员多达 800 人
item.description: 沃尔沃集团（Volvo Group）发言人周五表示，面对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策，由于市场不确定性和需求担忧，沃尔沃集团计划在未来三个月内在美国三家工厂裁员多达 800 人。【原文：Volvo Group plans to lay off as many as 800 workers at three U.S. facilities over the next three months due to market uncertainty and demand concerns in the face of President Donald Trump's tariffs, a spokesperson said on Friday.】

item.title: 唐宁街：英国首相斯塔默与特朗普讨论贸易问题
item.description: 唐宁街发言人周五表示，英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）进行了会谈，讨论了两国之间的贸易问题以及乌克兰和伊朗局势等其他议题。【原文：British Prime Minister Keir Starmer spoke with U.S. President Donald Trump, discussing trade between the two nations among other subjects including the situation in Ukraine and Iran, a Downing Street spokesperson said on Friday.】

item.title: 通胀进展缓慢，美联储戴利称可能需要等待降息
item.description: 旧金山联储主席玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）周五表示，虽然她对今年的几次降息仍然感到满意，但通胀风险的上升意味着央行可能需要做得更少，尤其是考虑到唐纳德-特朗普总统贸易政策的不确定性迄今为止几乎没有对仍然稳固的美国经济增长造成破坏。【原文：San Francisco Federal Reserve President Mary Daly said on Friday that while she is still comfortable with a couple of interest rate cuts this year, rising risks of inflation mean the central bank may need to do less, especially given that uncertainty over President Donald Trump's trade policy has so far done little to disrupt still-solid U.S. economic growth.】

item.title: 美国银行业监管机构批准 Capital One 与 Discover 的交易
item.description: 美联储和货币监理署周五表示，已批准 Capital One 和 Discover 合并，为两家公司成为美国第八大银行铺平了道路。【原文：The Federal Reserve and Office of the Comptroller of the Currency said on Friday they have approved the merger of Capital One and Discover, paving the way for the two firms to become the eighth-largest bank in the United States.】

item.title: 消息人士称巴西国家石油公司批准重启巴西东北部化肥厂招标
item.description: 据四位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，巴西国营石油公司（Petrobras）董事会周四批准了选择合作伙伴重启其位于巴西东北部化肥厂运营的计划。【原文：The board of Brazilian state-run oil company Petrobras on Thursday approved plans to select a partner to restart operations at its fertilizer plants in northeastern Brazil, according to four sources familiar with the matter.】
